abstract.text: Location Indicator layer.
The opacity of the entire location indicator layer.
Default value: 1. Value range: [0, 1]
The minimum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels less than the minzoom, the layer will be hidden.
A pre-specified location in the style where layer will be added to
(such as on top of existing land layers, but below all labels).

The color of the circle emphasizing the indicator. To adjust transparency, set the alpha component of the color accordingly.
Default value: “#ffffff”.

Location Indicator layer.
The bearing of the location indicator.
Default value: 0.
Transition property for
The color for drawing the accuracy radius, as a circle. To adjust transparency, set the alpha component of the color accordingly.
Default value: “#ffffff”.
The size of the bearing image, as a scale factor applied to the size of the specified image.
Default value: 1.

The amount of the perspective compensation, between 0 and 1. A value of 1 produces a location indicator of constant width across the screen. A value of 0 makes it scale naturally according to the viewing projection.
Default value: “0.85”.

The bearing of the location indicator.
Default value: 0.
Note! This is an experimental feature. It can be changed or removed in future versions.

Name of image in sprite to use as the background of the location indicator.
The displacement off the center of the top image and the shadow image when the pitch of the map is greater than 0. This helps producing a three-dimensional appearence.
Default value: “0”.
Layer types that will also be removed if fallen below this clip layer.
A style’s fog property is a global effect that improves depth perception by fading out distant objects.
A protocol used to create any type of  map style content, such as layers, sources, lighting and others.
A protocol describing a style-related entity that can be decoded.

The amount of the perspective compensation, between 0 and 1. A value of 1 produces a location indicator of constant width across the screen. A value of 0 makes it scale naturally according to the viewing projection.
Default value: “0.85”.
Transition property for
The slot this layer is assigned to.
If specified, and a slot with that name exists, it will be placed at that position in the layer order.

The amount of the perspective compensation, between 0 and 1. A value of 1 produces a location indicator of constant width across the screen. A value of 0 makes it scale naturally according to the viewing projection.
Default value: “0.85”.
An array of [latitude, longitude, altitude] position of the location indicator.
Default value: [0,0,0].

Warning: As of v10.6.0,
is the preferred method for atmospheric styling. Sky layer is not supported by the globe projection, and will be phased out in future major release.
